meanings.sent1: The redlined paper stood out in the stack.
meanings.sent2: The redlined document was easy to spot on the desk.
meanings.sent3: The redlined folder looked like a festive decoration.
meanings.sent4: The redlined border added a pop of color to the page.
meanings.sent5: The redlined map helped us find our way easily.

meanings.definition: To refuse a loan or insurance to someone because they live in an area deemed a poor financial risk.
meanings.sent1: The bank redlined the loan application due to the applicant's address.
meanings.sent2: The insurance company redlined the policy for the high-risk neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The bank's decision to redline the loan made the applicant rethink their choices.
meanings.sent4: The company's policy to redline certain areas was controversial.
meanings.sent5: The decision to redline the insurance application was based on statistical data.

meanings.definition: To set a limit on the amount of something that can be spent or borrowed.
meanings.sent1: The budget redlined the expenses for the project.
meanings.sent2: The bank redlined the maximum loan amount for the customer.
meanings.sent3: The decision to redline the spending limit surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The company redlined the budget to control costs.
meanings.sent5: The manager redlined the budget to ensure financial stability.
